Class Combinatorics

extends java.lang.Object

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static long binom(long n, long k)
      Computes the binomial coefficient $\binom{n}{k}$.
      static long binomMod(long n, long r, int p)
      Computes the binomial coefficient \(\binom{n}{r} \pmod p\), where \(p\) is a prime number Uses Lucas' Theorem and modular inverses.
      static int gosper(int n)
      Given an integer n, returns the next integer with the same number of set bits.

      • Combinatorics

    • Method Detail

      • gosper

        public static int gosper(int n)
        Given an integer n, returns the next integer with the same number of set bits.

        Known as Gosper's hack. Source: http://programmers.stackexchange.com/a/67087/51334 Useful for iterating over combinations containing k elements.

      • binom

        public static long binom(long n,
                         long k)
        Computes the binomial coefficient $\binom{n}{k}$.

        I'm careful with division and multiplication here to preserve (as much as possible) the validity of the answer accouting for overflow.

      • binomMod

        public static long binomMod(long n,
                            long r,
                            int p)
        Computes the binomial coefficient \(\binom{n}{r} \pmod p\), where \(p\) is a prime number Uses Lucas' Theorem and modular inverses. Assumes that \(p\) is prime--otherwise, undefined behavior results.
        Parameters:
        n - the \(n\) in \(\binom{n}{r} \pmod p\)
        r - the \(r\) in \(\binom{n}{r} \pmod p\)
        p - the \(p\) in \(\binom{n}{r} \pmod p\)
        Returns:
        the result of \(\binom{n}{r} \pmod p\)
